title: Kali Linux WiFi Managed Mode (from Monitor mode) : HackerD explains #shorts #wifi #kalilinux
description: Commands Used: iw dev Check the name of your wi-fi interface and use it in the following commands: sudo ip link set wifi_interface down sudo iw wifi_interface set type managed sudo ip link set wifi_interface up  #wifi #kalilinux #passwords
transcript: Did you know that you don't need to restart your operating system when your Wi-Fi adapter is in monitor mode? I've run the command iw dev to show that the adapter is in monitor mode. First we bring the interface down with the command sudo ip link set wlan zero down with our interface down we can now set the device to managed mode we use the command sudo iw wlan0 set type managed we now have to bring the interface up by using the command sudo ip link set wlan0 up we run the command iw dev and you can see the adapter is back in managed mode you need to put your adapter back into managed mode to access the internet.
